page.title: 02Bartley Middle School
page.content: {Bartley Middle School}is the only school remaining in the area. It became a Middle School in 1974 after having previously been a Secondary School. It caters for children in the 8-12 age group. Within the catchment area, there are insufficient pupils, so many are 'bussed' in from Lyndhurst. At present there are 290 on roll but numbers are falling. The School is arranged on a semi-open plan system, with all classrooms opening onto a central corridor. In the lower school, class sizes are 30-33 pupils and in the upper school class sizes are about 26. As well as the School's 11.5 teaching staff, it has a full time secretary and Caretaker, plus three kitchen staff and six cleaners. From Bartley, the children move to Hounsdown Comprehensive School
